	CORCEPT THERAPEUTICS INCORPORATED

<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We also issued 164,666 shares of common stock related to the exercise of a warrant in May 2014 that had been issued in the 2008 private placement. This warrant was exercised on a cashless net-exercise basis, wherein
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	an unaffiliated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	investor surrendered a warrant for 529,567 shares in exchange for the issuance of 164,666 shares of common stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following paragraphs describe significant transactions relating to the sale and issuance of common stock and the exercise and issuance of warrants during the year ended December 31, 2012. Information regarding the issuance of common stoc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	k upon the exercise of stock options is discussed below under the caption,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Option Plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Transactions during 2012
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On March 29, 2012, we issued 4.2 million shares of our common stock upon the exercise of warrants that we had issued in a private placement transaction in April 2010 at an exercise price of $2.96 per share and sold new warrants to the same investors to purchase 4.2 million shares of common stock at an exercise price of $4.05 per share. The new warrants
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	exercisable through March&nbsp;29, 2015. We generated net proceeds in these transactions of $12.8 million, after the deduction of issuance costs. Venture capital funds, trusts and other entities affiliated with members of our Board of Directors purchased 40 percent of the securities sold in this transaction, with the remainder being purchased by other qualified investors
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	July 6, 2012, we sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	11.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million shares of our common stock in an underwritten public offering at a price to the public of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$4.49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;per share, generating net proceeds of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$46.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million after deducting expenses of the offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	During the year ended December 31, 2012, investors exercised additional warrants for the purchase of our common stock with exercise prices ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.66
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.96
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result, we issued an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	216,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares of common stock and generated aggregate proceeds of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$470,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Registration Rights related to March 2008 Financing
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In March 2008, we sold 8.9 million shares of our common stock and warrants to purchase 4.5 million shares of our common stock in the March 2008 Financing. The registration rights agreement covering securities issued in the March 2008 Financing provides that if we do not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fulfill certain of our obligations under the registration rights agreement, we will be required to pay liquidated damages to the holders of the s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	hares and warrants. We filed the registration statement covering the resale of the shares sold and shares underlying the warrants sold in this transaction with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on April 11, 2008, and it was declared effective by the SEC on November 10, 2008. During 2008, we recorded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$1.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million in liquidated damages to other non-operating expense because of the delay in the effectiveness of the registration statement, which represented
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the purchase price.&nbsp;&nbsp;No separate contingent obligation has been recorded since that time as no additional liquidated damages have become probable of payment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have never declared or paid any
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Shares

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of common stock reserved for future issuance as of

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<TR>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On February
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, our Board of Directors authoriz
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ed an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million shares in the number of shares available under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Equity Incentive Plan
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	(the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Plan)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, which was equivalent to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the shares of our common stock outstanding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Option Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have two active stock option plans at December 31, 2015 &#x2013; the 2004 Equity Incentive Plan (the 2004 Plan) and the 2012 Plan.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2004, our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	board of directors and stockholders approved the 2004 Plan, which became effective upon the completion of our initial public offering (IPO).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Under the 2004 Plan, options, stock purchase and stock appreciation rights and restricted stock awards can be issued to our employees, officers, directors and consultants. The 2004 Plan provided that the exercise price for incentive stock options will be no less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the fair value of the Company&#x2019;s common stock, as of the date of grant. Options granted under the 2004
</FONT>
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	F-
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	15
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CORCEPT THERAPEUTICS INCORPORATED
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Plan vest over periods ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years. The vesting period of the options is generally equivalent to the requisite service period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In 2012, our board of directors and stockholders approved the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of the effective date of the 2012 Plan,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	5.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million shares that remained available for issuance of new grants under the 2004 Plan were transferred to the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	After that date,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	additional options were or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	will
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	be issued under the 2004 Plan. Vested options under the 2004 Plan that are not exercised within the remaining contractual life and any options under the 2004 Plan that do not vest because of terminations after the effective date of the 2012 Plan will be added to the pool of shares available for future grants under the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Under the 2012 Plan, we can issue options, stock purchase and stock appreciation rights and restricted stock awards to our employees, officers, directors and consultants. The 2012 Plan provides that the exercise price for incentive stock options will be no less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	percent of the fair value of our common stock as of the date of grant. Options granted under the 2012 Plan are expected to vest over periods ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years. We expect the vesting period of the options that we grant under the 2012 Plan to be generally equivalent to the requisite service period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Upon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	exercise of options, new shares are issued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	On February 18, 2015, our Board of Directors authorized an increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million shares in the number of shares available under the 2012&nbsp;Plan, which was equivalent to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	of the shares of our common stock outstanding as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2014, pursuant to the terms of the 2012 Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

</FONT>

	2013

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	aggregate intrinsic value in the table above represents the total pre-tax intrinsic value that option holders would have received had all option holders exercised their options on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. The aggregate intrinsic value is the difference between our closing stock price on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the exercise price, multipli
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	e
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	d by the number of in-the-money options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock-Based Compensation related to Employee and Director Options
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Assumptions used in determining fair value-based measurements for options to employees and directors
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The fol
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lowing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	table summarizes the weighted-average assumptions and resultant fair value-based measurements for options granted to employees and directors.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	1.54
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The expected term of options reflected in the table above has been based on a formula that considers the expected service period and expected
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	post-vesting termination behavior differentiated by whether the grantee is an employee, an officer or a director.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:22.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The expected volatility of our stock used in determining the fair value-based measurement of option grants to employees, officers and directors is based on a weighted-average combination of the volatility of our own stock price and that of a group of peer companies for those grants with expected terms longer than the period of time that we have been a public company. For stock options granted to employees with expected terms of less than the period of time that we have been a public company, the volatility is based on historical data of the price for our common stock for periods of time equivalent to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the expected term of these grants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We apply a forfeiture rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	zero
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	in our stock option expense calculations as we have a limited employee base
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	with minimal turnover
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. When an employee terminates, we will record a change in accounting estimate that represents
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	the difference between the expense recorded in the financial statements and the expense that would have been recorded based upon the rights to options that vested during the individual&#x2019;s service as an employee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
</P>
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&nbsp;

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CORCEPT THERAPEUTICS INCORPORATED
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTES TO FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, Continued
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Summary of compensation expense related to options to employees and directors
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recognized compensation expense of $6.0&nbsp;million, $4.7&nbsp;million and $5.1 million related to options to employees and directors during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, we had $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	12.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation expense for employee and director options outstanding as of that date, which had a remaining w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	eighted-average vestin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	g period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2.85
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;ye
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	ars.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock Options to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Non-Employees
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We expense stock-based compensation related to service-based option grants to non-employees on a straight-line basis over the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	vesting period of the options, which approximates the period over which the related services are rendered, based on the fair value-based m
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	easurement of the options using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. The assumptions used in these calculations are similar to those used for the determination of fair value-based measurement for options granted to employees and directors, with the exception that, for non-employee options, the remaining contractual term is utilized as the expected term of the option and the fair value-based measurement related to unvested non-employee options is re-measured quarterly, based on the then current stock price as reflected on the NASDAQ Capital Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We recorded charges to expense for non-employee stock options of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$87,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$470,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$127,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	for the years ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	award outstanding to a non-employee with an aggregate total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	17,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	shares unvested as of that date
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:4.5PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	9. Net Loss Per Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 24.5PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Basic and diluted net loss per share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. The computation of net loss per share for each period, including the number of weighted-average shares outstanding, is shown on the face of the statements of comprehensive loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have excluded the impact of common stock equivalents relating to shares underlying outstanding options and warrants from the calculation of diluted net loss per common share because all such securities are antidilutive for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The following table presents information on securities outstanding as of the end of each period that could potentially dilute the per share data in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 1PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon future earnings, if any, the timing and amount of which are uncertain.&nbsp;&nbsp;Accordingly, the net deferred tax assets have been fully offset by a valuation allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The valuation allowance increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$15.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$15.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million and decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had net operating loss carryforwards available to offset any future taxable income that we may generate for federal income tax purposes of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$178.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million, which expire in the years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, California net operating loss carryforwards of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$116.2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	million, which expire in the years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, and net operating loss carryforwards from other states of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$27.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million, which expire in the years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2023
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Our federal and s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tate net operating loss carryforwards as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 inc
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	lude amounts resulting from exercises and sales of stock option awards to employees and non-employees.&nbsp;&nbsp;When we realize the tax benefit associated with these stock option exercises as a reduction to taxable income in our returns, we will account for the tax benefit as a credit to stockholders&#x2019; equity rather than as a reduction of our income tax provision in our financial statements. Based upon our stock option exercise history, we believe such amounts are not a material component of our total net operating loss carryforwards as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, we also had federal and California research and development tax credits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$17.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	$2.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million, respectively.&nbsp;The federal research credits will expire in the years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2019
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	2035
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and the California research credits have no expiration date.&nbsp;Our deferred tax assets have been offset by a full valuation allowance as the realization of such assets is uncertain.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	Utilization of our net operating losses and tax credit carryforwards may be subject to substantial annual limi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	tation due to the ownership change limitations provided by the Internal Revenue Code and similar state provisions.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such limitations could result in the expiration of the net operating losses and tax credit carryforwards before utilization.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CORCEPT THERAPEUTICS INCORPORATED
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	&nbsp;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	The Company maintains liabilities for uncertain tax positions. These liabilities involve considerable judgment and estimation and are continuously monitored by management based on the best information available, including changes in tax regulations, the outcome of relevant court cases, and other pertinent information.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, the Company's total amount of unrecognized tax benefit was approximately $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	4.3 million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	There would be no impact to the effective tax rate if these tax benefits were recognized while the Company maintains a full valuation allowance. The Company does not expect its unrecognized tax benefits to change materially over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:27PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	While management believes that the Company has adequately provided for all tax positions, amounts asserted by tax authorities could be greater or less than the recorded position. Accordingly, the Company&#x2019;s provisions on federal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	state tax-related matters to be recorded in the future may change as revised estimates are made or the underlying matters are settled or otherwise resolved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	All tax years from inception remain open to examination by the Internal Revenue Service, the California Franchise Tax Board and other state taxing authorities until such time as the net operating losses and research credits are either fully utilized or expire.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	11. Commitments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	We have entered into a number of agreements to conduct clinical trials and pre-clinical studies for further development of Korlym and our proprietary selective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	cortisol modulators
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	. See the discussion in Note 2,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Significant Agreements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	fo
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	r further discussion regarding the commitments under these agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	In the ordinary course of our business, we make certain indemnities, commitments and guarantees under which we may be required to make payments in relation to certain transactions. These include indemnities of clinical investigators and contract research organizations involved in the development of our clinical stage product candidates, indemnities of contract manufacturers and indemnities to our directors and officers to the maximum extent permitted under the laws of the State of Delaware. The duration of these indemnities, commitments and guarantees varies, and in certain cases, is indefinite. The majority of these indemnities, commitments and guarantees do not provide for any limitation of the maximum potential future payments that we could be obligated to make. We have not recorded any liability for these indemnities, commitments and guarantees in the accompanying balance sheets. However, we would accrue for losses for any known contingent liability, including those that may arise from indemnification provisions, when future payment is probable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	such losses have been recorded to date.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	12. Quarterly Financial Data (Unaudited)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;TEXT-INDENT:24.5PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT">

	(a)
</FONT>

<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:5PT 0PT 0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:18PT;">

	Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
